android.gameengine.icadroids.engine

Class GameTiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.engine.GameTiles

  • public class GameTiles
extends Object
    The class that makes the tiles out of a tileArray. First, intialize the tiletypes with GameTiles.tiletypes, than set the tilesize with GameTiles.tileTypes, than make a tile Byte[][] map with the numbers corresponding the position of the array 'tileTypes'. -1 is no tile. Than add the map the map with 'addTileMap(map, 0, 0)'.
    Author:
    Edward van Raak

    • Field Detail

      • debugMode

        public static boolean debugMode
        If set to true, debug mode will show tile collision borders. Usefull for testing collisions without sprites. Might slow down FPS quite a bit.

      • tileTypes

        public static Sprite[] tileTypes
        Array that holds different TileTypes with each it's own sprites and behavior.

      • tileArray

        public static byte[][] tileArray
        Two dimensional array that holds the location of all tiles.

      • tileSize

        public static int tileSize
        The width and height of every tile. Default value set to 50.

      • tileRectArray

        public static RectF[][] tileRectArray
        List that holds all the retangle boxes that will be used for collision detection

      • tileTypeArray

        public static byte[][] tileTypeArray

      • tileBoxes

        public static Vector<RectF> tileBoxes

      • tileBoxID

        public static Vector<Integer> tileBoxID

      • tileMapHeight

        public static int tileMapHeight

      • tileMapWidth

        public static int tileMapWidth

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameTiles

        public GameTiles(GameEngine gameEngine,
         android.gameengine.icadroids.renderer.GameView View,
         byte[][] tileMap,
         int TileMapWidth,
         int TileMapHeight,
         int xPosition,
         int yPostition)
        This class is used to create TileBased games.
        Parameters:
        gameEngine - GameEngine
        View - The GameView Renderer
        tileMap - The 2D Map Array
        TileMapWidth - The total Width of the map array
        TileMapHeight - The total height of the map array
        xPosition - The start position X of where to start drawing the tiles.
        yPostition - The start position Y of where to start drawing the tiles.

      • DrawTiles

        public void DrawTiles()
        Loop through the TileArray to create Tiles. The TileType is checked on every loop so that the correct sprite is drawn.

      • changeTile

        public static void changeTile(int xTile,
              int yTile,
              int tileType)
        Change a tile in the game world.

        Notes

        The x and y positions are the indices in the tile-array, not the x and y positions in the world.
        A negative value for the tilenumber removes the tile at the given position.

        Parameters:
        xTile - the y-pos of the tile in the tile array
        yTile - the y-pos of the tile in the tile array
        tileType - the new sprite type that should replace this tile

      • deleteTile

        public static void deleteTile(int xTile,
              int yTile)
        Delete a tile in the game world.

        Notes

        The x and y positions are the indices in the tile-array, not the x and y positions in the world.

        Parameters:
        xTile - xTile the y-pos of the tile in the tile array
        yTile - yTile the y-pos of the tile in the tile array
